In Gter Ma, you play one of two sides: a thief who is trying to steal a gter ma (an ancient Tibetan Buddhist teaching) from a monastery or the lone monk who is trying to protect it with the help of his trusty, if a bit senile, Tibetan mastiff.

If you play as the thief, you’ll be trying to sneak through the tall grasses into the monastery in the dead of night when the monks are all asleep, tiptoe past the guard dog who isn’t as vigilant as he used to be, and steal the gter ma from inside. Then, you’ll sneak back out and sell those sacred teachings for as much as possible on the open market.

If you play as the monk, you’ll be trying to stop the thief from making it into the monastery by laying traps
on the front lawn. Being a devout pacifist, though, none of your traps will harm the thief - but they will make enough noise to rouse the attention of your very old guard dog, who will then fiercely protect the door, making entrance impossible.

Download the game for free here: http://bit.ly/121IEBx

187868.name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – 54 Card Expansion Pack

boardgamehonor.26780: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

144811.description:
Fleet: Arctic Bounty expands the award-winning card game Fleet with 120+ new cards including:


New Premium Licenses, Base Licenses, and Boat Cards with all-new bonuses
New Dock cards with more ways to build your Fleet
All new Crewman cards and Gone Fishin'
Brand new one-player and two-player variant cards and rules
An updated rulebook


Fleet: Arctic Bounty is designed to integrate with Fleet and give players the ability to choose which License and Boat cards to play with in any given game, creating endless possibilities of card and power combinations and replayability. Want to try a game without Processing Vessel and Shrimp? Then take them out and add Pacific Oyster and Swordfish! Players can choose any combination of old and new licenses from Fleet: Arctic Bounty and Fleet to create exciting new gameplay experiences.

Fleet: Arctic Bounty provides modularity, variety, and new strategic paths to victory!
144811.name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty

144812.name: Scorpions' Cove
144812.description:
In Scorpions’ Cove, you play pirates who stumble upon an island laden with gold - and, as the name would suggest, overrun with scorpions. The last crew to stop here didn’t make it off the island, and their treasure is just lying out in the open for the taking.

Luckily, you have a good apothecary on board, and he’s able to compound an antidote for you. of course, like any good pirate apothecary, he’ll give you one for free to get you started, but the rest are going to cost you. So, off you head to Scorpion’s Cove to seek your treasure. The bold will get more gold - but they’ll also get stung more. The cautious may not be injured, but they won’t make nearly as much. Choose wisely...

On each player's turn, he or she may draw any number of cards from the deck. If a player encounters three or more scorpion cards, he'll be stung - and without Antidote cards to cover the stings, he'll have to be carried back to the ship by his crewmates, who'll take all of his treasure while he's unconscious. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins!

144813.description:
From Publishers website:

ATS TIMMES' ORCHARD II—The All American 82nd Airborne Division is a new ATS Historical Module that tells the story of the Battle of Normandy from the perspective of the 82nd Airborne Division, the American paratroopers tasked with protecting the Utah Beach exits from the Hitlerian boast that the invaders would be...driven back into the sea...and the efforts of the tyrant's generals to carry out that wish.

LES HEUTES, NORMANDY, 8 June 1944: By D+2 Lt. Colonel Timmes and his men received an enormous psychological boost in the form of a telephone line across the marsh to the far shore of the Merderet River. He also had the shaken glidermen who had fallen back to the orchard after the confusion of the night. As dawn broke, the men of the 1/325th were in the process of regrouping, and had yet to dig in. There was no relief in sight for Timmes and his men. The “secret ford” was a precarious lifeline, swept by fire and barely usable during daylight hours. As casualties continued to mount among the men in the orchards scores of wounded threatened to overwhelm the wholly inadequate medical facilities. And the German determination to retake the crossing would soon prove to be undiminished.

IN EACH GAME YOU GET:

A large-hex 22” x 34” two-piece color map on heavyweight stock; researched onsite by designer Ian Daglish;
A Battlefield Walkaround booklet
7 Scenarios printed on heavyweight cards
All the combat counters needed to play, just bring your ATS rules, play aids and markers and a ten sided die
A snazzy ziploc-style bag to keep it all in.
144813.name: ATS: Timmes Orchard

144814.name: Edmus
144814.description:
User Summary

Edmus is a semi-racing game with the layout and controls of a sidescrolling platformer. You control your Edmus character and try to get as far as you can in the level without missing a jump, or hitting an object. If either of these occur your run will end.
Along the way you will collect flowers. These can be spent to permanently upgrade your speed, your jumping ability and your double jumping ability. The race about distance not speed, the player who runs the farthest wins. When you play you will see the likeness of the players who also played that same day, and they will die off just as the players did in their run. There is also a population marker that tells you how many other players made it as far as you did that day.

144815.name: Doctor Who and the Doom of the Daleks
144815.description: "Doctor Who and the Doom of the Daleks" is an as-yet unauthorized cooperative board game for 2 to 4 players. Players play as Companions to "the Doctor" and together try to rid time of the scourge of the Dalek invasion. Each turn more Daleks enter the board at different Eras of time (similar to the spread of diseases in Pandemic) and it is up to the Doctor and his Companions to "purge" them. On a player's turn, more Daleks spawn, and then the player gets 2 actions: 1 Companion action, and 1 Doctor action. Play continues until either the Daleks win by 1) killing the Doctor 4 times (the Doctor starts with 3 regeneration tokens), 2) spawning all Daleks from the supply into the timeline, or 3) taking control of 3 Eras; or, the Companions win by purging the entire timeline of Leader Daleks, AND placing Time Seals in 3 Eras.

144816.name: Gyossait
144816.description:
User Summary

A dark and unsettling platoform adventure game. This game has multiple endings depending on the choices the player makes. You start with only a shield, but can get weapons as the game progresses.

144817.name: Cat God vs Sun King
144817.description:
User Summary

The followers of the Sun King are building a mighty temple. As the Cat God you are not happy with this. Kill off those building and supporting the building of the temple to progress to more difficult challenges. Use earthquakes, fireballs, giant worms, soul jars, skeletons, locusts, confusion and more to hamper their plans and kill them. Buy upgrades with achievements to enhance your destructive skills.

144818.name: Vehicle Upgrade Manual
144818.description:
From the introduction:

Special Supplement 3: Vehicle Upgrade Manual adds many new design options to Supplement 5-6: Vehicle Handbook. There are three new chassis types on offer; ekranoplans, rocket planes and ornithopters.

Also in this book are rules for vehicle maintenance, design flaws, new modifications, and new weapons. A system for creating ultra-heavy vehicles is also present, suitable for making the very largest planet-bound vehicles. Finally, there is a section for making vehicular robots and drones.

Several new vehicles are also provided, making use of the new design options and rules.

144820.name: Gladiator
144820.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are You Not Entertained

With the Gladiator, a full 20-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll be able to dazzle both onlookers and foes alike with unique fighting styles and unorthodox combat! Rise from slave to hero to the chorus of an adoring crowd!

144821.name: Half-Elf
144821.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Best of Both Worlds!

Just because you're a half-elf doesn't mean you have to get the short end of the stick! With Half-Elf you'll get a 15-level class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games! A touch of charm, a bit of wit, and a sword are all you need when you're a half-elf!

144822.name: Half-Orc
144822.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beyond the brutality!

Cursed blood flows in your veins, but that doesn't stop you from being a hero! With the Half-Orc you'll find a full 12-level class that harnesses brute strength and primal fear for use with Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games.

144823.name: Halflings: Tales from the Fireside
144823.description:
From publisher blurb:

EVEN THE SMALLEST PERSON CAN BECOME A BIG HERO!

Halflings are often regarded as lazy, boring busybodies by the rest of the world. But inside those bodies beats a heart of fire! In Halflings: Tales from the Fireside you'll get a look inside halfling culture and society as well as learning new options for your halfling character. While this supplement is specifically designed for use with the Labyrinth Lord role-playing game, it can easily be adapted to any old-school fantasy game with minimal effort!

Inside You'll Find:

New Magic Items: From the Fancy Waistcoat to the Lucky Sling-Stone, your halfling will always have a trick up their sleeve!
New Class Alternatives: Now you don't have to become a Sheriff! Whether a Treasure-Seeker, Stout-heart or Lucky Fool, you'll always be ready for adventure!
New Monster: Learn about the Boogans! A twisted race of creatures that plague the halflings!
And much more!

144824.name: Earthdawn Player's Guide (Revised Edition)
144824.description:
From Publishers website:

THE AGE OF LEGEND

Before science, before history, an era of magic existed in our world’s dim past. Magic flowed freely, touching every aspect of the lives of men and women of the Namegiver races. It was an age of heroes, an age of fantastical deeds and mythical stories. It was the Age of Legend.

Bold heroes from all across Barsaive band together—ready to fight for life and freedom against the remaining Horrors and the oppressive Theran Empire, which seeks to bend the rebellious province again to their yoke. Through noble deeds and sacrifice, the heroes of the world forge Barsaive’s future, arming themselves for their daunting task with powerful magic and treasures.

The Earthdawn Player's Guide™ takes player characters from First to Eighth Circle in their Disciplines and contains revised game mechanics, spells, talents, skills, and much more!

The Revised Edition of Earthdawn® supersedes the Third Edition (ED3), previously published by RedBrick LLC. However, if you already own or are using ED3 rulebooks or sourcebooks, they are completely compatible with the Earthdawn Revised Edition.

This core rulebook is for players and Game Masters. For a complete Barsaive experience, the GM will require a copy of the Earthdawn Game Master's Guide™.

144825.name: Mythic Adventures

rpghonor.26117: 2014 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Gold Winner

144825.description:
From the publisher:
Heroes of Legend

Not all heroes are created equal. Many adventurers pick up swords or call upon strange powers in times of trouble, yet only a few are chosen by fate or the gods to change the course of history. These are mythic heroes—legendary figures whose every footstep shakes the heavens. With Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, it’s your turn to change the world. Choose a mythic path and take on unbelievable powers by completing mythic trials tied to your character’s story. Each mythic path works in parallel with your character class, allowing you to continue advancing in your chosen calling even as you seek a greater destiny. Best of all, you can start playing a mythic character at any point—even as early as 1st level!

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures is a must-have companion volume to the Pathfinder RPG Core Rulebook. This imaginative tabletop game builds on more than 10 years of system development and open playtests featuring more than 50,000 gamers to create a cutting-edge RPG experience that brings the all-time best-selling set of fantasy rules into a new era.

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures is a 256-page hardcover book that includes:


Complete rules for playing mythic characters of six different paths: archmage, champion, guardian, hierophant, marshal, and trickster.
New mythic feats for every class, such as Powerful Shape, which allows druids to transform into enormous animals, or Deadly Stroke, which lets a mythic character dispatch even a formidable enemy with a single blow.
A whole grimoire of new and supercharged spells. Bring down a castle with a mythic meteor swarm, transform the landscape with terraform, or make every memory and record of someone disappear with mythic modify memory!
Tons of monsters enhanced with mythic abilities and ready to challenge your heroes, from dragons to vampires!
A hoard of new mythic magic items and artifacts. Brandish the sword of inner fire, capable of burning even elemental creatures, or turn your enemies to stone with the medusa-headed shield aegis!
A complete mythic adventure for 7th-level characters.
Advice on running a mythic game and forging your own legends.
AND MUCH, MUCH MORE!

144826.description:
In an apocalyptic world in which everyone over the age of 18 has turned into a bloodthirsty, flesh-hungry zombie and most youngsters have been served as meat to quell their elders' appetite, a small team of kids and teenagers tries to survive on their own. As part of that small group of survivors, you must unite to escape the relentless horde of undead. Run across town to find shelter or food, hold a strategic position, meet with new survivors, and discover the truth about this terrible and mysterious disease!

Zombie 15' is a frantic, scenario-based survival game in which time is scarce and cooperation is key. The game features easy rules but real choices to be made as quickly as possible if you don't want to get overwhelmed by zombies!

Zombie 15' features a team of 15-year-old teenagers; a 15-minute soundtrack to give each game its tempo; a 15-scenario, progressive campaign; and much more than just 15 zombies...
144826.name: Zombie 15'

144827.description:
Description from the publisher:

As the war grows ever deadlier, soldiers have come to rely on the safety that battlefield fortifications can provide. This box contains rules to deploy bunkers, strongpoints, trenches, and barbed wire to anchor your front line.
144827.name: Dust Tactics: Operation "Achilles"

144828.name: Walt the Fox
144828.description:
If you like popping bubbles and eating chicken, this is the game for you. You are Walt, a nice fox, whose sole purpose is to catch and eat as many chickens as possible. Over the four seasons, you will meet new animals that will help you or slow you down in your endless quest for chicken. Try to get the highest score in each level to become the King of the Chickens. Also try to catch as many chickens in Time Trial mode. For the more adventurous, keep calm and catch a maximum number of rabbits in Fashion Rabbits Madness! Connect with your Google+ account to share your scores with friends and other players!

Features:
- 4 different seasons!
- Different styles of play to unlock!
- Special powers to discover!
- Combos to earn more points!
- 30 achievements to unlock!
- 3 rankings!

Source: The Game Website. Translated from the original French.

144829.description:
France 1914, is a relatively simple, straightforward simulation of Germany's long-planned but only nearly successful attempt at a quick victory in Northwest Europe in 1914.

It is corps-to-army level with 10 day turns until the end of November.

Mata Hari is in it, as are The Taxicabs of Paris.

It plays in an hour or two.

France 1914 is FREE to print off and play at http://www.coatneyhistory.com/France1914.htm , but do look up Patrick Tremoureux's professional redos of the map and units here under his (trem_pk) entry on BGG.
144829.name: France 1914

144830.name: Minotaur
144830.description:
From publisher blurb:

Grab the Bull by the Horns!

Stepping out of classic mythology, the Minotaur is a full 12-level class for Labyrinth Lord that brings the savage cunning of these hellenic monsters to your gaming table. Whether as a player character or as an empowered monster to face heroic adventures, it's sure to have your foes seeing red.

144831.name: Ninja
144831.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spies, Infiltrators, Assassins!

They go by many names, for they wear many masks. But with the Ninja, a new 14-level player character class for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll see behind the shadows and learn the ancient art of deception!

144832.name: Rune-Smith
144832.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic from the Deep Places of the Earth!

Dwarves are said to have no affinity for magic, But this is a myth. They practice a rare and secret art, known as Rune Magic! With these unique abilities earth and stone bend to their will and no dungeon is too dark for them to brave! The Rune-Smith is a full 12-level class for Labyrinth Lord and other old school fantasy role-playing games.

144833.name: Samurai
144833.description:
From publisher blurb:

Live and Die with Honor!

Living an ancient code and sworn unto death to serve their lord, the Samurai is a new and powerful warrior for Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games. With this 20-level player character class, you'll bring new options to your character and untold honors to your lord!

144834.name: Shootist
144834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Give 'em Both Barrels!

With the Shootist you'll bring the danger and excitement of black powder weapons to your Labyrinth Lord game! This full 15-level player character class adds to your arsenal of weapons and options as you delve the dungeons of your favorite old-school fantasy role-playing game!

In addition to this complete class, players are given complete rules for incorporating firearms into both Labyrinth Lord and any other old-school fantasy role-playing games!

144835.name: Smith and Scholar
144835.description:
From publisher blurb:

More than just a sword!

With Smith and Scholar you'll be able to bring a collection of new aspects and abilities to your Labyrinth Lord characters! You're not just a thief, but also a fence. Or maybe your magic-user is also a necromancer. Or perhaps your halfling is touched by luck! With this supplement, you can expand your options without having to add a whole new proficiency and skill system to your old-school fantasy role-playing games!

144836.name: Swashbuckler
144836.description:
From publisher blurb:

Always with the greatest of ease!

Just because you're crawling through a dungeon, doesn't mean you can't have style! With the 20 level Swashbuckler class you'll bring a dashing swordsman to even the darkest dungeons of your Labyrinth Lord or other old-school fantasy role-playing games!

144837.name: Tanuki
144837.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part Spirit, Part Mortal - All Mischief!

The mysterious tanuki is an elusive nature spirit given to pranks, mayhem and chaos. This wily shapeshifter will offer a new style of trickster for use your Labyrinth Lord campaign - or for any other old-school fantasy role-playing game. This full 8-level player character class is an exotic twist on classic asian mythology.

144838.name: The King Betrayed
144838.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Caverns Old...

The Hall of Iron was to be the first of hall of King Thraindan's new empire. But when jealousy, betrayal and a terrible curse took hold of clan, his people were destroyed by treachery from within. Now the Hall of Iron has been discovered and its riches lay untouched for generations. But who knows what terrors await those foolish enough to enter this tomb.

The King Betrayed is a short stand-alone adventure for use with Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games. Designed for 4-6 player characters of 3rd-5th level, this module provides material for an evening of adventure as well as plot hooks that can easily be transformed into an entire campaign.

144839.name: Undead Slayer
144839.description:
From publisher blurb:

Go Back to the Shadows!

The darkness of the night and those who rise from the grave hold no fear for the Undead Slayer! With this brand new 20-level class for use with Labyrinth Lord and other old-school fantasy role-playing games, you'll be armed against even the worst creatures of the night!

144840.name: Wanderer
144840.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not All Who Wander...

The Wanderer is a nomad who has become rugged and travel-worn from the trials of the road. With this full 14-level class for Labrynith Lord and other old-school role-playing games, you'll never get lost in your adventures. By picking up a collection of skills and abilities from other classes, the Wanderer is a new and dynamic class for your game!

144841.name: Free Trader
144841.description:
From publisher blurb:

To the Edge of the Stars

Space Fleet doesn't have the only ships exploring the edge of the galaxy. Free Traders are indepedent ship captains and crew who make their way in the universe by fast wits and wily trades. Whether they're on the edge of the known universe or slipping illegal cargo past a Space Fleet blockade, the Free Trader brings a new player character class and new dimensions to your Starships & Spacemen, 2nd Edition game.

144842.name: Mercenary
144842.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gun for Hire

Not all travellers across the endless light years of the Confederacy are heroes and diplomats. The Mercenary is a new class for Starships & Spacemen, 2nd Edition that gives you the opportunity to pit your player characters against bounty hunters, trained commandos and space pirates - or even turn your S&S game on it's ear by taking up the role of one of these cut throats as a player character!

144843.name: Star Ambassador
144843.description:
From publisher blurb:

Knights of the Mind

With the Star Ambassador you'll bring new talents and abilities to your allies in Space Fleet! This original class will bring new abilities and options to your Starships and Spacemen, 2nd Edition game. Designed exclusively for use with Starships & Spacemen, this class presents a unique psychic class with classic sci-fi themes fans have come to know and love.

144844.name: Tic Tac Boom
144844.description:
Tic Tac Boom contains the original tic tac toe game plus three brand new challenging modes, that will make you explode from its sheer awesomeness. Play in two boards at the same time with Twin Mode, explode your opponents pawns in Tic Tac Boom mode or play Sudden Death where there can be only one winner! No match is the same in Tic Tac Boom and no strategy can bring you a certain victory. Revel in chaos!

Source: The Developer Website.

144845.description:
SPI boxed game of 3 different Middle Earth games: War of the Ring is the big game, the 2 small games are Gondor and Sauron.

Gondor is based on the siege of Minas Tirith along with the battle outside the city gate as depicted in J.R.R. Tolkien's novel The Lord of the Rings.

Sauron is a simulation of the Battle of Dagorlad from the 2nd Age of between Sauron and the forces of the Free Peoples (elves, men and dwarves) outside the main gate of Mordor.

In War of the Ring, great armies battle while another game is going on at the same time with individual characters around the fate of the One Ring.
144845.name: The Games of Middle Earth

144846.name: Uptake
144846.description:
From publisher blurb:

UPTAKE!!

Fresh from the villainous files of Sketchpad Studio is Uptake! With a mere touch, Uptake can take on the properties of any substance, giving him a flexible array of abilities. Does your campaign need a new challenge? With ties to two villainous organizations, Uptake may be your man!

144847.name: Styroform
144847.description:
From publisher blurb:

STYROFORM!!

Villainous master of metastyrene, Styroform is a Gen- villain that's looking to make his world better one crime at a time. Do your heroes have what it takes to defeat him? Or will he start taking over their city one block at a time?

144848.name: Antihero
144848.description:
From publisher blurb:

ANTIHERO!!

Cursed with powers that are slowly eating away at him, Antihero works to solve his predicament and harness the power of anti-matter. Working as an agent for Crimenet and H.A.D.E.S., he summons forth his anti-matter form to destroy anyone that may stand in the way of his goals.

144849.name: Knockback
144849.description:
From publisher blurb:

KNOCKBACK!!

Heroes of the world beware, Knockback is on the loose! Nigh-Invulnerable and with enough strength to send most heroes into orbit, she'll smash any do-gooders that get in her way!

144850.description:
From a dark land in the far North, a malevolent being known as the Overseer sends an army to conquer the baronies of Elsemore, a sprawling human nation that once stood against an invasion led by an ancient dragon. Spearheading the army is a party of four dark Champions, personally picked by the Overseer himself.

You are those Champions.

We Are Darkness is a fully cooperative dungeon-crawl game with a built-in campaign system and a strong narrative aspect, immersing the players in a rich story of the fantasy world of Artha.

Guide your party through an epic three-act campaign. Earn experience, discover treasure and conquer new lands. Hone the skills of your party, acquiring powerful Character Abilities and unlocking Achievements. Extort conquered regions between missions or send raiding parties in search of valuable and elusive Artefacts.

We Are Darkness can be played in its default Campaign Mode over multiple sessions or in the Free Play Mode, allowing the players to choose a set of objectives and face the challenges of a single, longer quest providing them with an opportunity to try different ability and equipment loadouts.

In We Are Darkness no two sessions will ever be the same, as every mission (both in the Campaign and in the Free Play Mode) is generated using a random set of locations and enemies. As your Characters grow in power, the defenders of Elsemore learn new tricks to stand ever more valiantly against the coming Darkness.

A simple but robust combat and magic system, a strong tactical aspect, and an immersive, gritty story – all that and much more await you in We Are Darkness, a true resurrection of the classic cooperative dungeon-crawl experience.
144850.name: We Are Darkness

144851.description:
The Mayfair Game Variants & Mini-Expansions Set #1 comprises expansions for 10 Mayfair games:

Nuns on the Run: The Anchorite - This token is used in a game with only 1 or 2 Novices to effectively shrink the size of the board. In a 4 player game it can be used to change the landscape a bit.
Giza: The Great Pyramid: Fast Sleds - This gives players the opportunity to potentially push two sleds on their turn.
Lords of Vegas: Sky Bridge / Building Boom - adds the option to use the 2 provided skybridge tokens.
Atlantis: Boat expansion - A mayfair version of the small expansion which was a free give-away at Essen 2009. This one has cardboard chits instead of wooden ships. The boats function more or less like the bridges in the base game, but you can use other people ships to cross, by paying the correct amount to the bank or half the amount to the player whose ship you use.
Rocket Jockey: Space Port - adds variants to mid game scoring and alternatives when drawing cards.
Urbania: Subsidy Contracts - Adds tokens that can be used either in hiring or as extra workers. Also adds "Italian Politics Variant".
Catan: Victory Point markers - Victory point chits.
Steam: Five Way Town - This tile adds five track access into one town.
Whitewater: Cranky Beavers - This expansion adds a movable obstacle into play, the Cranky Beaver, and gives options for a Sudden Death Ending and a Rough Rapids variant.
Aeroplanes: Aviation Ascendant: Charters - This expansion adds ways to enter a city without being closed out.
144851.name: Mayfair Game Variants & Mini-Expansions Set #1

144852.name: Modern Armored Conflicts: 1970s
144852.description:
M.A.C. (Modern Armored Conflicts) is a tactical land-combat simulation that covers (at least initially) the 1970s Central
Front with the US, USSR, UK, and FRG forces well represented. The game scale is 3 minutes/turn, 250m per hex. The 'standard' unit is the Platoon, but individual squads, sections, or vehicles may be used as well (these are called 'Elements' in the game). The goal of the game design is to allow a game with up to 1 (or possibly 2) Battalions on each side but keep a sufficient level of detail that each major-caliber round fired is accounted for. The maps provided are based upon real locations in the Northern / Central German theatre covered by the game.

The basic counter represents a Platoon; each platoon has a number of Strength Points equal to the number of squads or
vehicles in that platoon. The game system allows one to account for each major-caliber round fired without requiring
the tedious book-keeping that often occurs in such detailed-level games.

GAME CONTENTS:

1 x Rules Manual (~50 pages), 12 x Color Cardstock Reference Sheets, 10 x full-color Map Sheets (each 11" x 17") (some
maps are geomorphic, some are stand-alone), 2 x Ten-Sided Die, 1 x CD-ROM with > 200 user-printable Unit Data-Record
Sheets / off-board Artillery Record Sheets / and Bonus Materials, 2 x 1/2" Counter Sheets (560 counters total), 12
Scenarios included with guidelines on how to create your own.

144853.name: Hiversaires
144853.description:
Created for adventurers who remember to draw maps to survive. The dark world of Hiversaires features an original Aliceffekt soundtrack to lure you through its entangled corridors.

Source: The Developer Website.

144854.name: Finding Teddy
144854.description:
A little girl was sleeping peacefully with her Teddy bear, when suddenly, a monster popped out from her cupboard then stole her favorite plush.
When closing the door, the little girl awoke then got inside the cupboard. She's projected in a magical world, full of monsters and oddities where she has to discover the place and help their beings and find back her Teddy.

Still one question remain : will she be able to go back to the real world ?

Source: The Publisher Website.

144855.name: Rogue Legacy

videogamehonor.33147: 2013 CVA Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee

144855.description:
Rogue Legacy is an indie game platformer with roguelike elements. Whenever a character dies as a result of losing all of their Hit Points (HP), control will transfer over to one of three randomly generated heirs, each with their own unique characteristics and abilities. Such genetic peculiarities include color-blindness (in which the game is presented in black and white), ADHD (in which the player moves faster) and dwarfism (in which the character is short and can fit into small gaps).

Source: Wikipedia, "Rogue Legacy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144856.name: Roolipelaaja (Issue 8 - 2007)
144856.description: Theme of this issue is horror and creation of the right mood for horror games.

144857.name: Hexshogi
144857.description:
Hexshogi is a shogi variant for two players. The gameboard comprises 85 hexagonal cells. The game is in all respects the same as shogi, except that piece moves have been transfigured for the hexagonal board-cell geometry.

Source: Wikipedia

144858.name: Trishogi
144858.description:
Trishogi is a shogi variant for two players. The gameboard comprises 9×10 interlocking triangular cells. The game is in all respects the same as shogi, except that piece moves have been transfigured for the triangular board-cell geometry.

Source: Wikipedia

144859.name: Masonic Shogi
144859.description:
Masonic Shogi is a shogi variant. The game is played on a modified shogi board whereby alternating ranks are indented to the right—resembling masonry brickwork. The moves of pieces are adapted to the new geometry; in other respects the game is the same as shogi.

Source: Wikipedia

144860.name: Space Shogi
144860.description:
Space Shogi is a three-dimensional shogi variant. The gameboard comprises nine 9×9 shogi boards stacked vertically. Each player controls a standard set of shogi pieces.

Source: Wikipedia

144861.description: Ace in the Chains: A Disc Golf Game is a light, fun print-and-play board game designed to simulate the tough decisions and tension of disc golf. Players plan their throws on a modular board; hazards including water, trees and hills are all that keep you from sinking an Ace in the Chains. Whoever has the lowest total number of throws at the end of three holes will be the winner!
144861.name: Ace in the Chains: A Disc Golf Game

144862.description: Water Balloon Washout is a 2-4 player card game where players take control of a group of kids having a water balloon fight. In the game players play Attack, Defense and Utility cards to try and keep their kids in the game while at the same time eliminating the other players' kids.
144862.name: Water Balloon Washout

144863.name: Paper Tigers
144863.description:
From the Rules:

"Paper Tigers is designed as an introduction to miniatures war gaming for the beginner. It is intended to be played with paper miniatures printed in 1/72 or 1/76 scale. To that end, the rules
are kept deliberately easy to learn. This does not mean the rules are unsophisticated. Players will find that good tactics are generally rewarded. Paper Tigers uses a standard deck of playing cards to generate an interesting and sometimes surprisingly tense turn sequence. Higher value cards allow you to act first, but they are more difficult to successfully use. Lower value cards are easier to use, but with them, you are more likely to act after your opponent. Most players! initial games are likely to be solo efforts. This does not pose a problem as Paper Tigers is purposely designed to work well in singleplayer games. The card-driven turn sequence combined with other mechanisms that limit player control make Paper Tigers highly suitable for solo play yet still provide an enjoyable multi-player game."

144864.description:
Ascension: Darkness Unleashed is both a standalone game for two players and an expansion that can be combined with Ascension: Rise of Vigil or other Ascension games.

Ascension: Darkness Unleashed features "Dark Energy Shards", a new take on the "Energy Shard" Treasure cards introduced in Ascension: Rise of Vigil. Like an "Energy Shard", a "Dark Energy Shard" allows a player to draw a new card while providing one energy to power up Energize cards. In addition, the Fate effect allows each player to banish a card in his discard pile whenever a "Dark Energy Shard" is placed in the center row.

This set also features new Energize cards, including Heroes, Constructs and Monsters that transform into new beings or more powerful versions of their original selves. If you would play a card that has a Transform ability and you've met the Energize threshold on that card (by having played a certain amount of energy that turn), then you ignore all the effects on the original card and place the transformed card in your hand, which can now be played this turn and on future turns for the remainder of the game. (Ascension: Darkness Unleashed contains both double-sided transform cards for those who play with card sleeves and single-sided transform cards for those who don't. In the former case, you remove the card from the sleeve, flip it to the transformed side, then resleeve it; in the latter, you remove the original card from the game and bring in the transformed card.)

Other cards – such as the monster "Erabus, the Exiled" – are transformed and added to your hand when you defeat them in the center row. At the end of the game, you score Honor for whichever version of the card is currently active in your deck.
144864.name: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed

144865.description:
Sushi Draft is a fast little card game that looks good enough to eat! Over three rounds, players draft plates of sushi and collect sushi points, which are drawn randomly. The player with the most diverse menu gets dessert!

Sushi Draft includes a deck of 32 sushi cards (8 ikura, 7 ebi, 6 maguro, 5 tamago, 4 kappa and 2 "wild" triples) and 18 point tokens (three each for the five types of sushi and three for dessert); the point tokens range in value from 1-5, with the more plentiful sushi dishes being worth more points. At the start of each round, players shuffle the cards and receive a hand of six cards. Players simultaneously draft a card from their hand and reveal it, placing it on the table. They then keep one card, pass the remainder to a neighbor, and draft and play again. Once everyone has five cards in front of them, players receive point tokens. Whoever has the most sushi of each type draws a point token of that type at random; if players tie for the most of a type, however, then the player with the secondmost of that type draws the token instead. If all players are tied, then no one scores for that type of sushi. The player with the most types of sushi scores a dessert token at random.

After three rounds, players tally their points, and whoever has the highest score wins!
144865.name: Sushi Draft

144866.name: Polkovnik Oktober
144866.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ripped from the pages of Deus ex Historica.

Polkovnik Oktober is the master spy, the spider sitting in the center of a web of intrigue. Unlike Mother Bear, he doesn’t use calculated charm, honey traps or betrayals, but relies instead on efficient, cold-blooded blackmail and killings to achieve his successes. He’s the mundane master of disguise, who could show up anywhere, being anyone to achieve his aims, then become anyone else to get away. He’s a chess master, and if the heroes suspect he’s behind a plot, they should be getting worried, even if he does lack superpowers.

This release contains details a silver age villain PL 12.

This is the 31th in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

144867.name: Plutonium Man
144867.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ripped from the pages of Deus ex Historica.

Plutonium Man is a good symbol of the atomic scare. The man is a walking nuclear weapon with an itchy trigger finger. He might be calm and move on, or he might go off and start destroying everything in his path. If engaged in combat, he will cut loose with eye blasts first and keep on blasting with his highest damage attack. He will use the x-ray blast if grappled, and the nuclear blast if he is being attacking from multiple sides.

This release contains details a silver age villain PL 12.

This is the 30th in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

144868.name: The Happiest Days of Your Life
144868.description:
User Summary

The Happiest Days of Your Life' is a flip-screen, side-facing arcade adventure sharing many gameplay similarities with the Wally Week games. Objects, such as the postage stamp and the objet d'art, have to be collected and placed correctly in order for the portly protagonist to progress, whilst avoiding all manner of hovering, boarding-school themed nasties including walking canes and tuck shop sweeties -- all of which seek to deplete his life gauge and render him unable to complete his quest to retrieve the headmaster's missing wallet!

144872.name: Sailing (1987)
144872.description:
From the back of the box:

SAILING is a game of strategy and simulation designed to capture the thrill of competing in top-level sailing competitions. You'll need all your wits about you as you design your boat to take part in this international challenge.

Out there on the ocean, use your skills as a seaman to steer your yacht around the buoys on the course, deciding when to hoist the spinnaker to your best advantage. And don't forget to watch out for the weather - just one gust of wind can blow your chances of winning.

Sixteen nations compete - only the strongest can win!

144873.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Venture into the dark heart of ogre country with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: The Hook Mountain Massacre (a.k.a., Rise of the Runelords - Adventure Deck 3). This 110-card expansion to the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords Base Set includes new locations, monsters, villains, loot, and more, as well as five new scenarios that constitute the complete Hook Mountain Massacre adventure. Continue your character's legend with the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: The Hook Mountain Massacre!
144873.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Hook Mountain Massacre Adventure Deck 3

133038.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set

144874.name: Trailer Park Boys Board Game
144874.description:
Welcome to Sunnyvale!

This is the official Trailer Park Boys Board Game – an original game of strategy and luck.

Have you ever dreamed of owning a Trailer Park? Well now you can with ‘The Plan – Freedum 35’! Relive your favourite episodes as one of twelve characters. Rip each other off or work together. Start up a night club, star in a porno or get in a shoot out! Pull off different scams like stolen shopping carts, recycled bbqs or siphoned gas. Along the way, fool Sam Losco, trick Cyrus or outsmart Lahey. Dodge the cops while trying to grow dope in your very own trailer. Get your grade 10 or play hockey in Jail. Harvest your Outdoor and ride to riches on the Swayze Express. Make enough money to buy the Trailer Park and win the game!

144875.name: Deep Space Prospector
144875.description:
Deep Space Prospector is a real-space game that plays on your coffee table. Players are space miners rushing to explore far away galaxies and ruthlessly exploit them for massive profits.

Players randomly disperse asteroids around a central space station to create a playing board. Markers indicating power reserves are lined up to plot a course to asteroids and for the return home.

The goal is to carefully use your power reserves to travel to asteroids, mine them, and safely return to the space station. Points are earned for successful mining and remaining power. Be the most successful space prospector to win, but be wary of running out of power and being stranded in space forever!

144876.name: The Fire Within
144876.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Every so often, an immortal is born among us. Inevitably, they lead great armies, rule vast empires, and shape the world around them. The divine spark burns within you, and now is the time of your story. Or at least, it will be, if you can get out of this backwater village. A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144877.name: A Help from My Little Friends
144877.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

You have drawn the attention of the locals. With that attention comes both their worship and their problems. When the village’s very survival is threatened, it is up to you to take care of them. But what do you do when their enemy isn’t really the enemy? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144878.name: The Rarest Bloom
144878.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Once more, your reputation as a god has brought the people to you in need. The wisest villager in Longhill has gone missing, and the others don’t have anywhere else to turn. Can you help him out of a sticky situation, and finish his work for him? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144879.name: Outside Looking In
144879.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

You've left the rural farms and villages behind, and made your way to Northvale, the jewel of the Agris Valley. The Church of Light doesn't want anything to do with you, so they send you off on a fool's errand. But is it really just the tip of an iceberg? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144880.name: Knee Deep
144880.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

An unruly neighbor is causing trouble for the village of Deep Marsh. The Church of Light would like you to investigate and sort out the problem. No one expects you to return, but that's only half of it. Can you get to the bottom of things, before it spills out into the world? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144881.name: Every Day Above Ground
144881.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A tattered old scroll goes missing, and everyone is too busy to track it down. When you do, it’s clear that not the scroll, but rather the ancient ruins it described, is the real goal. Can you reach the heart of the matter, before the enemy does? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144882.name: Another Rainy Day in Wood's Edge
144882.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The crack of thunder, the flash of lightning, the rush of wind through the trees. An immortal tempest has beset the village of Wood's End. Can you survive her wrath, or will you fall victim to the eye of the storm? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144883.name: No Stone Unsung
144883.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Deep in the wilds of the valley lies a circle of stone monoliths. The wind between the ancient stones sometimes becomes whispers of prophecy and fortune. Visiting the oracle has become a rite of passage for immortals in the Agris Valley. Will you hear words of wisdom, or return home empty-handed? A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144884.name: A Day in the Life of a Deity
144884.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

An entire city of the valley has gone silent, and something is obviously amiss. An entire city of the valley has gone silent, and something is obviously amiss. An entire city of the valley has gone silent, and something is obviously amiss. A Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3.

144885.name: As He Lay Dying
144885.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

A mysterious invader has stormed his way into the Agris Valley. The Guardian has rallied you and the other immortals of the valley to the field of battle, to protect your homeland. In the end, nothing will be the same. A two-round Special Campaign Introductory Adventure for character levels 1-3, and the finale of the Introductory series.

144886.name: Salvage Rights
144886.description:
From the introduction:

Salvage Rights is the second adventure in the Grendelssaga (after Rescue Run), a series of three adventures set on the rogue world of Grendel, in the Queen Alice’s Star system. Grendel is largely unexplored, an uninhabitable world in the next orbit out from the human colony world of Beowulf.

Salvage rights are a concept in maritime law, that were later extended into outer space. These laws state that a person or organisation who recovers another person’s ship or cargo after peril of loss at sea or in space is entitled to a reward commensurate with the value of the property.

In popular culture, salvage rights are thought to means that the recoverer, or salvor, is entitled to the actual property itself. This is incorrect. They are entitled to fair recompense, up to the actual value of the property itself. In special cases, this can mean possession of the property, but this is rare.

In the case of alien artifacts, all are automatically the property of whatever local government holds the balance of power, though in theory alien artifacts should be returned to representatives of their species.

Not all species share this point of view.

144887.name: Fiends with Benefits
144887.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Your search for answers has led you to the Silent City, a place that was crushed by the same Dark Lord that destroyed your past. The city is held captive by the tyranny of vicious devils, but perhaps you can find an ally within its walls. A Core Adventure for character levels 1-5, and part 1 of the Tormented Land series.

144888.name: Keep Your Fiends Close
144888.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The devils of the Silent City are tearing the town apart looking for you, and the resistance is getting nervous. It’s up to you to regain the advantage... but in the process, you may learn exactly what they are hiding. A Core Adventure for character levels 1-5, and part 2 of the Tormented Land series.

144889.name: Fiends in Low Places
144889.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Desperate to learn the secret of the devils, you assault the Silent Citadel itself. What you find beneath its halls may change everything. Will it be for the better? A Core Adventure for character levels 1-5, and part 3 of the Tormented Land series.

144890.name: A Fiend in Need
144890.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

It is time to bring the Silent City’s resistance movements together, and break the chains that bind them. A traitor, however, could ruin everything. Can you unmask him, before time runs out? A Core Adventure for character levels 1-5, and part 4 of the Tormented Land series.

144891.name: With Fiends Like These
144891.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

You have learned of a portal within the Silent City - the link between the devils that rule the land, and the Dark Lord that commands them. If you can disrupt it, the resistance will have an advantage. But are you prepared to deal with the cost? A Core Adventure for character levels 1-5, and part 5 of the Tormented Land series.

144892.name: A Fiend 'til the End
144892.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

The time has come – the mortals of the Silent City rise to your banner. Can you overthrow their devil overlords, and restore peace to the realm? A Core Special Adventure for character levels 1-5, and the finale of the Tormented Land series.

144893.name: Super Trooper
144893.description:
Super Trooper is science fiction fantasy crossover trading card game based on the rules of Doomtrooper card game. The theme is alternative universe of parallel reality where the nations as we know them ceased to exist and multinational corporations took all the power. Theme is mainly dystopian but with strong signs of humor and parody. Besides high tech the game contains also supernatural powers and magic.

The players are representing warlords controlling their piece of land out of dominance of corporations. But the warlords are in battle conflict against each other and they have to buy mercenaries and battle technology from corporations. Each player has his/her own deck of cards representing single soldiers, equipment, fortification and so on.

The goal of the game is to earn 20 reputation points by killing the opponent's soldiers.

The game is published in Czech language under Creative Commons license, which means the cards can be shared and reproduced legally but the author's name must be preserved and changes cannot be done without notification.

144894.description:
First Part of the Age of Steam 2013 set released by Alban Viard

These expansions take place in the Alps. For the first time, players will use the box to simulate the mountains.

This expansion features stickers to make tunnels and to pass throughout the box.

Both maps make use of this very innovative concept.
144894.name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Alps

144896.description:
This is the second part of the Age of Steam 2013 set released by Alban Viard

These expansions take place over a giant map (90cm × 42cm) to make the Mediterranean map and a world map.
The first one has many boat links and very few hexes;

the second one adds the flight connection between giant capitals of the world.
144896.name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Giant Maps

144897.description:
This is the third part of the Age of Steam 2013 set released by Alban Viard

These pair of expansions is called Railroad Switches (again never seen in the Age of Steam world).

This expansion introduces two new maps with special rules for rotating complex hexes, and a special station master action!!!
144897.name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Railroad Switches

144898.name: Bar Oasis
144898.description:
User Summary

A visual novel coupled with bar tending. As per a standard visual novel, the game flows via text and stills. Unlike other visual novels however, Bar Oasis spices things up by having the player prepare drinks as a bar tender.

Drinks are based on real recipes, while preparing such concoctions makes use of the your iOS device's motion sensitivity. Players will tilt their iOS device side ways in order to pour and mix different drinks, pinch the screen in order to squeeze fruit, and motion their iOS device in order to stir or shake their masterpiece.

Make drinks such as simple Martinis, the traditional Godfather, and even 007's Vesper.

Aside from making quality drinks, the player is likewise tasked to serve customers and to keep them happy.

144900.name: GameMaster's Guide (HackMaster 5th Edition)
144900.description:
From the product website:

This black grimoire is the long awaited HackMaster GameMaster’s Guide. It is an indispensable weapon in your arsenal; a must for those with a desire to take up the GM’s Shield and referee HackMaster. All things HackMaster are made possible by the secrets contained herein.

As a HackMaster GM you bear an enormous weight and responsibility on your shoulders: judging and running combat, interpreting the actions of your players, creating adventures, world building, assigning experience, keeping track of Honor, and so on. And that’s just at the game. Before the game, you are preparing the adventure for the next session(s) and working on your campaign. For many, you also have to get ready to host the game itself, and sadly, most of you fork out your hard-earned cash for the game books and accessories in order to play the game. In addition, you must constantly work at mastering the rules of the game and honing your skills.

Like the captain of a ship at sea, you must constantly strive to maintain your game. Clearly, the role of GameMaster is a daunting job by anyone’s standards.

But chances are that if you have felt compelled to answer the call, you have the right spirit, drive and determination to rise to the challenge. And fear not! For you are not being sent into the fray unarmed. Armed with this book you are a formidable individual with whom all must reckon. You will gird up your loins, don the armor of confidence that comes with knowing that you are a cut above the run-of-the-mill gamer and proclaim, “The GameMaster is always right!”

Table of Contents
Chapter One: GameMastering Advice
Chapter Two: Combat
Chapter Three: The Adventure
Chapter Four: Spellcasting
Chapter Five: The Journey
Chapter Six: Between Adventures
Chapter Seven: Character Vitals
Chapter Eight: Zero Level Characters
Chapter Nine: NPCs
Chapter Ten: Design Advice
Chapter Eleven: Treasure Tables
Chapter Twelve: Non-Monetary Treasure
Chapter Thirteen: Quality Items
Chapter Fourteen: Magic Items
Appendix One: NPC Descriptions
Appendix Two: Diseases
Appendix Three: Kalamar
Appendix Four: Index

The GMG is a full color, hardcover book 368 pages in length.

144901.name: Thing On A Spring
144901.description:
Thing On A Spring is a side-scrolling platform/puzzle game produced in 1985 for the Commodore 64 by Gremlin Graphics. Gameplay involves controlling a character resembling Zebedee from The Magic Roundabout through a toy factory while avoiding evil toys.
The game was written by Jason Perkins, Anthony Clarke and the graphics were by Mark Rogers, with musical score composed by Rob Hubbard, his first composition for a game . In his Zzap!64 review, Julian Rignall exclaimed, "The sound is unbelievable, I won't describe it but just wait until you hear it; words fail."
Along with Rockford from the game Boulder Dash, the Thing On A Spring character became a regular graphic element printed in the margins of Zzap!64.
Thing Bounces Back was released as a sequel in 1987, also by Gremlin.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thing on a Spring", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Individual credits:
Rob Hubbard: Music (C64)

144902.name: Trouble in Northamlet
144902.description:
Over a century ago, the lizardfolk tribes of the Great Swamp were united by a warlord with megalomaniacal ambition. His name is lost: he was known only as the Lizard King. He whipped the lizardfolk into a frenzy and drove them to rampage across the region, slaughtering those who fought back and enslaving those who surrendered. The region's leader, the Count d’Orlon, fell in battle and all seemed to be lost. Finally, near the sleepy village of Northamlet, the count's teenage daughter, Justîne d’Orlon, slew the Lizard King in bloody combat. The horde scattered and the horror and slaughter were over forever. Or so everyone thought...

Trouble in Northamlet is an adventure front for the Dungeon World RPG. It presents the skeleton of a complete original adventure, inspired by a classic old-school TSR module from the 1980s. With it and a minimal amount of prep work, a GM has enough material for several sessions of play, as well as the set-up for a longer campaign arc.

144903.name: Curvy
144903.description:
Each Curvy puzzle consists of a grid of hexagonal tiles. On each tile appears a single or double set of lines, and each set of lines has its own color. These tiles must be rotated to find a solution in which lines of the same color connect, with no loose ends.

Curvy allows a variety of different puzzle sizes, providing puzzles that can be quickly solved as well as more complex versions depending on the size you choose. Originally an Android application, you can now play Curvy online or on the go.

Source: The Game Website.

144904.name: Alight (In Dreams)
144904.description:
Alight is a platformer that mixes exploration and reflexes and more than a little story. Move with the arrow keys, fly with the space bar or up arrow. If you find yourself having trouble getting much altitude, trying pressing the space bar at a slower pace until you find the right rhythm. And remember that you can always drop down out of a flock of birds without using a flap of your wings with the down arrow key.
Every time you enter a door, your game is automatically saved, and you can replay a level at any point.

Source: The Publisher Website.

144907.name: noitcelfeR
144907.description:
User Summary

A platformer where some blocks and enemies cast reflections on the ground below, and some don't. To progress you have to look at both parts of the screen and put together where you can and can't walk, and where it is safe to go.

144909.name: The I of It
144909.description:
User Summary

Once upon a time there was an I and a t. "Bah" said the t, and left. "Where is t?" I was wondering. And started the quest. You will play as I on its quest for t. This plays like a puzzle/platformer. I can move left or right, and grow and shrink but not jump. The edges of the I can be used to grab onto objects and then pull itself up among other ways to utilize I shape to get through the levels.

144912.name: HEX-A-GONE
144912.description:
HEX-A-GONE is an abstract strategy game played on an hex-hex tile board. Players move their pawns on tiles worth 1,2 or 3 points. They collect the starting tiles of their pawns, thus shrinking the board with every move. The goal is to have the most points when no player has legal moves or everybody passed.

HEX-A-GONE appears to be very similar to Hey, That's My Fish! but with a couple of extra special tiles: the "portal" and the "patch".

144913.name: Trickle
144913.description:
Abstract strategy board game, similar to a reverse "chinese checkers" with shared pieces.

Players alternate moving one bead of the common pool from the center of the hex-hex board towards the border. They may do simple moves or jump other beads.

The end of the game is when all beads are on the border. The player with most beads on the border hexagons of his color wins.

The link of the game at the Game Crafter Website is: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/trickle

For those willing to play test the game on a digital mobile device, Trickle is available on Android (completely free, includes ads): https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=air.com.trickl...

144915.name: Dying Star: Oblivion
144915.description:
A skirmish miniature wargame set in the Dying Star universe created by Samsun Lobe.

The game promises access initially to six factions based on Lobe's literary works.

The game creators have noted Dying Star will offer


Quick and easy army construction. You choose your forces and upgrades and you're good to go.



Low setup requirements. You can play a game with just 2d10 if your memory is good enough.



Fast paced, brutal, decisive gameplay. Non-interactive victories are completely against our philosophy.



Based on a pre-existing world. Samsun Lobe has crafted a fantastic world for us to use in his Dying Star trilogy.

144916.name: Relics Armistice League
144916.description:
From the publisher website:

Relics: Armistice League (RAL) is a fantasy football game unlike any other. There is no ‘gaming board’ or ‘grid movement’ for RAL…. because RAL is not a board game! 

The game is played on a 2’ by 4’ board with fluid, free movement measured in inches.

The game makes use of a card deck that allows the players to boost rolls or scupper the opponents.

Players must gamble during the 'Play Book' phase to try and steal the initiative. RAL uses an activation point system coupled with an Active-Reactive player status to activate the models.

However, each turn the players need to try and ‘steal the initiative’ by betting some of their teams activations.

Win the bet and you steal the initiative for that turn, lose the bet and you find yourself on the back foot, having to try and react to the opponents moves in the hope you can hold them  back long enough to steal the initiative back next turn!

The Active-Reactive player system brings with it the fluidity of the sports pitch to your gaming table! The players take it in turns to activate a model but being the reactive player means your players on are on the backfoot and the opponent can run run straight past you before you can muster you defences and stop the rush towards your goal zones!

144917.name: Eat Me!
144917.description:
Eat Me! is a fun and simple card game about monsters eating other monsters. Bigger monsters eat smaller monsters, but even the biggest monster falls to the power of monstrous card combos and abilities. In this "monster eat monster" world, the monster (and player) who proves hungriest triumphs!

On a turn, a player wants to build his personal stack of monster cards. To do this, he takes two actions from these five possible choices, repeating an action, if desired:


Draw a card from the common deck of monster cards.
Discard a card from his hand.
Eat a monster by placing a card on top of any player's monster card stack as long as it meets two criteria: 1) the card is a higher value than the top card of the card stack and 2) the card is a different color than the top card of the stack.
Breed monsters by discarding two cards of the same color from his hand, thereby earning a special monster power (e.g., look at an opponent's hand, or choose a card and put it in your hand).
Discard a three-card poker combination from his hand to perform a super monster power, such as eating a monster without meeting the criteria.


The game ends the instant that the common monster deck runs out. Each player then counts the number of cards in his personal monster card stack, and the player with the most cards wins.

144918.description: Tokens made from 1/8" clear acrylic to use in conjunction with our 18XX Dividend tracker. 6 of our 5/8" clear acrylic discs along with 1/2" inkjet printed stickers. The stickers are our own custom design made to emulate the tokens in the game. *Some assembly required. *discs may come with colored plastic coating on the back use a fingernail to remove the coating before use. Dividend Tracker not included

boardgameaccessory.23817: 1861: The Railways of the Russian Empire

144918.name: 1861 Dividend Token

144919.name: TrackMania² Valley
144919.description:
User Summary

TrackMania² Valley is the third environment of the TrackMania² series.

In addition to the regular single-player and multiplayer modes, and the modular track editor that is a hallmark of the series, TrackMania² Stadium also supports the creation of custom game modes.

144920.name: Sunken Abode of the Batrachian
144920.description:
User Summary:

This gives a detailed old-school one-level dungeon: one page for a map and random encounters, and two pages detailing the keyed areas of the map.

144921.name: Sir Froig: NPC and paper miniature
144921.description:
Introductory Paragraph:

A marshy inlet near Marqueyssac would be unremarkable save for the fact that a small rain cloud continually hangs low in the sky above it - and for the strange little fellow who lives there. In most respects he appears no different from a simple if uncommonly large frog, but what noticeably sets him apart (aside from his obvious intelligence and ability to speak) is his albinism.

144922.name: Deceit of the Demon Frog God
144922.description:
From the Introduction:

A 4-6 level adventure for 2 or more players.

Avoiding inspection and the king's taxes you smuggle your goods along the back trails of the forest. Rounding a bend in the road, you see an eight foot tall stone statue of a bloated frog carrying a rose and a basket.

144923.name: Madness of the Frogmen
144923.description:
Designer's Description:

Over at B/X Blackrazor, JB issued a challenge to create an adventure based on a creepy statue that Tim of Gothridge Manor posted.

Within this 4 page adventure you will find 3 new monsters, a map, and a description of the idol of Whisk!
From the Introduction:

A Side-Quest Adventure for a Party of Old School PCs, Levels 4-6. This adventure is designed for use with the BECMI/RC edition of D&D.

144924.name: Gundam War Nex-A
144924.description:
The successor of the Gundam War CCG. Although most mechanics are still similar, Gundam War Nex-A was designed as the next "age" of the CCG, featuring a different card backs and streamlined rules.

As the namesake implies, players take control of the various Mobile Suits and pilots of the different Gundam series. In addition to the previous shows, such as the ones set in the Universal Century like Zeta and Char's Counterattack, the game also features the alternate timeline series, such as Wing, 00, Turn-A and, the newest addition, Gundam Age.

Similar to Gundam War, combat in Gundam War Nex-A is still divided into two zones, Earth and Space, with the players able to designate different Units into squads. Players attack one another in turn, attempting to deplete each others' Nation Pile(Draw deck), in order to win. Character or Operation cards can be placed on existing Units, giving the assigned Mobile Suit or Armor a bonus in its stats or additional effects. Command cards also give one time effects which players may trigger during their appropriate phases. Ace cards, the rarest card type typically found in boosters, combine Units and Characters into one cost efficient card.

Unlike Gundam War however, Gundam War Nex-A no longer has Generation(Resource) cards. Instead, each card can be played as a resource. Further, Roll-ing(Tapping/activating) a card may now include a cost in resources. Alternatively, players have the option of using Graphic card, which combines resource generation, buffing and defense into one card.

Though the card backs of Gundam War Nex-A are different from Gundam War, Gundam War cards can still be converted for use in Gundam War Nex-A, though with a penalty or drawback of sorts.

Gundam War Nex-A is only available in Japanese.

144926.name: Mecha: Mercenaries
144926.description:
from the back of the book

Don’t Fight for Loyalty

Loyalty is overrated. Sure, you can swear allegiance to a nation or a state, but when the going gets tough, are they really going to remember you?

Don’t Fight for Glory

Yeah, you think you’re hot stuff because you’ve got a killer mecha. You probably think you can take the galaxy on all by yourself, but let’s get real. You’ve been watching too many bad action movies. One pilot and one mecha can’t change the world, but you know what you can do?

Fight for Money!

Welcome to the world of Mecha Mercenaries where the mecha pilots, be they the vilest evil or the purest of heart, all fight for one thing: money.

Mecha Mercenaries is an expansion for the Mecha role playing system. This book gives players everything they need to create their own mercenary pilot and mercenary unit. You’ll find rules for logistics and battlefield salvage, and a system for managing the ongoing finances of a mercenary in demand all using Mecha’s easy-to-learn rules.

Also, if you want it, you’ll get a shot at the Crimson Throne. The Crimson Emperor is dead and the nobles he left behind are hiring every able body the can find to fight their wars for them. That’s where you come in. Live long enough and you’ll get rich. Heck, you might even get the chance to sit atop the Crimson Throne yourself.

If that’s not your thing, there are plenty of rules to make your own setting. Lots of places in this galaxy need a few steady warriors.

Metal and Flesh, Fight for Cash, Together as One!

The universe is at war mecha pilot. Go fight!

144927.name: Mecha: Combiners
144927.description:
From the back of the book:

I’m not Strong Enough on My Own…

The battle field is a lonely place. As an elite mecha pilot, it’s your job to win every battle piloting your twenty foot tall mechanical warrior. But sometimes, one mecha is not enough.

The Enemy is Too Powerful

Kami spirits infesting feudal Japan, dishonorable generals turned traitor, teams of super villains bound by destiny to work together, horrible magical creations forged by unimaginable energies, alien societies protected by mechanical soldiers, and teams of lawyers hell bent on taking your family restaurant…

These are the enemies that await you and your mecha and each are too strong for you to face alone.

We Must Combine!

Mecha Combiners is the long anticipated supplement for the Mecha role playing game. This book gives Mecha players everything they need to create their own combiner, a super robot formed by other mecha joining together. Combiners also features new super robot Configurations--special equipment the Combiner can use to form fiery swords, energy boomerangs and leap across the field in a single jump.

Also included is a full Combiners setting, where players take on the role of ronin who are out to defeat a possessed general who turned against his former master and murdered him. Let your mecha pilots fight amongst these tattered ruins of feudal Japan or create your own setting with guidelines included in the book.

Metal and Flesh, Live and Die, Combined Together as One

Now…go fight!

144929.name: The Sorcerer of Volupa
144929.description:
From publisher blurb:

Embark an an Arabian adventure of swashbuckling, sword, and sorcery!

When a princess is kidnapped by an evil sorcerer, the Sultan of Juman offers bold adventurers rich rewards for her safe return. But the sorcerer of the island of Volupa is well protected. Pirates, monsters, and the very sea itself seem to protect his island from unwanted heroics. The jungle island itself is said to be teeming with monstrosities assembled by the sorcerer to protect his sanctum. This swashbuckling adventure will require all the cunning and high-flying action the heroes can muster!

In addition to an Arabian adventure of swashbuckling heroics, this product features:

A 6-page landscape format GM’s screen full of useful information for running Honor + Intrigue for both GMs and Players alike.
8 new Dueling Styles for use with any Honor + Intrigue campaign including:
Wilhelm Tell (crossbow)
Badiya Siklon (“Desert Cyclone”, paired scimitars)
Baaz Ke Panje (“Falcon’s Talon”, scimitar and knife)
Fedai (heavy scimitar)
Fate’s Favorite (for one armed with sheer luck)
Kurash (wrestling)
Yilan Azidiş (“Serpent’s Fang”, paired knives)
Yıldırım (“Lightning”, scimitar)
And advice for augmenting “The Eastern Style” from Honor + Intrigue.

New Middle Eastern equipment including the kris, kukri, talwar, heavy scimitar, and chainmail armor
8 sample PCs so you can dive right into the adventure. There is even advice on how to customize this adventure for certain PCs to personalize the game.

144930.name: The Saint
144930.description:
From publisher blurb:

While Clerics use the power of the gods to their own ends, the Saint is the keeper of the will of her deity, always furthering the beliefs and decrees handed down directly from on high. She preaches the gospel of her church and tries (tactfully) to convince those around her to accept the light (or darkness) of her patron deity. As she grows in strength and favor with her patron deity, the Saint unlocks truly divine powers, culminating in her ascension as a literal herald of her deity.

144931.name: Eldritch Conjuror
144931.description:
From publisher blurb:

While many who dabble in the arcane become adept at beckoning monsters from the farthest reaches of the planes, none are more skilled at commanding these powers than the eldritch conjuror. This practitioner of the forbidden arts is skilled at summoning the maddening forms of these unspeakable creatures. As a boon from the ancient beings which they drawn the secrets of their magic, an eldritch conjuror is sent a servitor from beyond the stars. This alien creature acts as his servant, gaining power as the eldritch conjuror unlocks of the secrets of madness. As the eldritch conjuror’s mind further erodes from his obsessive study, he eventually becomes a physical vessel for these elder beings. Shedding the weakness of his mortal flesh, he transcends into one of the outsiders from which he draws his powers.

144932.name: Apostle
144932.description:
From publisher blurb:

To the common people it is often a mystery as to how the gods works through mortal agents. The apostle is a member of the clergy who has been gifted miraculous powers by their deity. Unlike most holy men that struggle through a lifetime of trials to understand the meaning of their faith, the apostle did not choose to follow their god; instead, their god has chosen them to be a messenger in these dark times. These divine agents are granted their abilities without choice, selected by their deity to wield an inner fire that even they do not fully understand. Unlike a cleric, who draws divine magic through a lifetime of devotion, apostles garner strength and power directly from a deity which has selected them to serve as a worthy vessel for their power.

144933.name: Host your own Horror Evening
144933.description:
Horror Evening Board Game for 3-6 players aged 14 to adult...In this role-playing board game you chose who to invite,the monstrous character they should come as & what they should wear.

The players are monsters haunting houses, collecting lost souls whist trying to avoid becoming "one what is cursed"

The characters are

Quasimodo

The Vampire

Frankenstein's Monster

The Witch

Werewolf

The Mummy

Box Contains:
Hosts Guide.
Invitations.
"Wicked Nibble & Bite" Recipes
38 Wicked Grin cards
38 Doom & Gloom cards
24 Ghoul and monster Cards
5 tomb cards
6 soul cards
Glass beads
Playing Board & 6 Counters & Die
Sound Effects Cassette Tape.

144934.name: Riders of the Night
144934.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ripped from the pages of Deus ex Historica.

Polkovnik Oktober is the master spy, the spider sitting in the center of a web of intrigue. Unlike Mother Bear, he doesn’t use calculated charm, honey traps or betrayals, but relies instead on efficient, cold-blooded blackmail and killings to achieve his successes. He’s the mundane master of disguise, who could show up anywhere, being anyone to achieve his aims, then become anyone else to get away. He’s a chess master, and if the heroes suspect he’s behind a plot, they should be getting worried, even if he does lack superpowers.

This release contains details a silver age villain PL 12.

This is the 32nd in a series of releases that will make up the final Deus ex Historica.

144935.name: Arthur's Realm
144935.description:
Arthur's Realm, a.k.a. Realm of Logres, is a character-driven game set upon a rich tapestry of Arthurian lore, characters and events. Players have many choices, but players need only learn a handful of simple mechanisms to begin play. This is because the game is built upon a simple "rules when you need them" principal that puts most of the rules on a handful of reference cards that need to be read only when you need to play a particular situation. Because the system is intuitive and easy to start, players don't spend time reading and memorizing rules. Instead, they just play.

In Arthur's Realm, your choices as a player impact the story of King Arthur, and each time players play the game, it tells a new and fascinating version of King Arthur's tale. The game is competitive and collaborative, with one team seeking to usurp King Arthur while the other defends Logres and King Arthur. The action in the game revolves around quests, treachery, character romance, combat and magic.

Arthur's Realm plays like a Eurogame in that players cannot be eliminated from play. It plays like an RPG in that players must collaborate and it doesn't hurt to have a good imagination. Arthur's Realm plays like a traditional American game in that at some point you'll want to smite the opponent.

144936.name: ZOMBI FINAL
144936.description:
Zombi Final is a game that uses two decks and a dice. Its operation is simple and addictive. You will be able to play alone or with three companions more, in cooperative mode or in a battle of all against all. In this game, your are a survivor of the zombie apocalypse fighting for your live against an army of the undead. You will have only a few weapons and barricades to resist until you get a rescue or die trying.

Are you ready to see your table filled of zombies and more zombies in a fight for your survival?

144937.name: Yoiso Flowers
144937.description: Yoiso Flowers is a card game that challenges players to quickly and efficiently reduce their starting hand size of 10 cards to zero before their opponents do. Cards are played to 2 different piles and card order must always follow a simple matching rule of Large flower to Small flower of the same color. But this is not just a simple color and pattern matching game. Players can set up combos that allow for multiple cards to be played in a single turn, traps that cause their opponents to draw more cards, and force opponents to play specific card types. In the end, the player who can manage their card hand and takes advantage of card plays will win the game.

144939.name: Savage Insider (Issue 9 - Jul 2013)
144939.description:
Savage Insider
Issue #9
July 2013
Tales of the Weird

Cover by Unholy Vault Designs
